channel.title: We got our first paying customer!
channel.description:
Hi guys,
We just got our first paying customer for http://Resamazing.com. I'm super stoked! Just wanted to share that information here with the people who have supported me with great advice and feedback.
This customer bought the yearly plan ($45). Oddly enough, the customer found us through one of my Reddit posts.
We haven't begun advertising the service to our target audience (job seekers) yet. So hopefully we can greatly increase our sign ups once we do.
I know we have a long way to go. But this is my first taste of validation.
Thanks for the advice everyone!

item.title: We got our first paying customer!
item.dc:creator: colarosa_
item.description:
Pretty neat, I can’t wait to get my first paying customer – well technically I have four but I’ve yet to receive any money because they’re all in the 30 day trial stage.

Congratz!

Alessandro Colarossi
colarosa.com

Read full topic
item.source: We got our first paying customer!

item.title: We got our first paying customer!
item.dc:creator: iammorton
item.description:
Hi Paul. I did specifically mention Resamazing in the post.

I’ve also answered a few additional questions in the resumes sub-reddit. I try to be as helpful as I can and provide a well-thought answer to a person’s question. If applicable, I’ll let them know about Resamazing somewhere in the comment.

We’ve received a couple of similar comments throughout our testing. I’m definitely going to change it.

Appreciate the advice!

item.source: We got our first paying customer!

item.title: We got our first paying customer!
item.dc:creator: shazow
item.description:
Very cool, congratulations!!

Some quick unsolicited feedback,

Yearly
$3.75
per month
( in one $45 payment)
save $15

is kind of hard to read, almost intimidating. I’d consider one of…

$5/month, or $3.75/month paid yearly (save $15).

$5/month, or $45/year (save $15).

Anyways, congratulations! Looks like a very slick product, keep it up.

Read full topic
